snippet: Images of a man’s last moments on a subway track provoked outrage and discussion about what bystanders should — or could — have done.
abstract: Photograph by freelance journalist of a clearly agitated man pushing Ki-Suck Han into the path of an oncoming subway train in Midtown Manhattan is causing many New Yorkers to question what they would do if they were witnesses to, or the victim of, such a harrowing incident; police are questioning a suspect in the case but have not brought any charges.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WILSON and DANIEL KRIEGER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Joseph Goldstein, J. David Goodman, William K. Rashbaum, Wendy Ruderman and Nate Schweber.

lead_paragraph: Images of a man’s last moments on a subway track provoked outrage and discussion about what bystanders should — or could — have done.

headline.seo: Suspect in Fatal Subway Push Is in Custody
headline.main: After Fatal Subway Shove, Asking: Were There No Heroes?
headline.print_headline: After Fatal Subway Shove, Asking: Were There No Heroes?
